item.title: Disable Nginx logging
item.description: This is something that is specified clearly on the Nginx manual, but it’s nice to have it as a quick reference. The access_log and error_log directives on Nginx are on separate modules (HTTP Log and Core modules respectively) and they don’t behave the same way when all you want is to disable all logging on your server (in our case, we serve a gazillion static files and perform a lot of reverse proxying and we’re not interested on tracking that).
